summary: A British journalist based in New York emails Daniel Bates, referencing prior collaboration on a Daily Mail story featuring photos of Peter Mandelson. The journalist is working on a piece for The Sun opposing Mandelson's potential appointment as UK ambassador to the US due to his links to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Peter Mandelson
persons.role: British ex-cabinet minister, potential UK ambassador to the US
persons.context: Subject of a planned news article due to his links to Jeffrey Epstein; appeared in photos published by the Daily Mail.

persons.name: Daniel Bates
persons.role: Recipient of the email, photographer or source of photos
persons.context: Addressed by a British journalist who previously worked with him indirectly when the Daily Mail printed some of his photos related to the Epstein story.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as someone whose trial was covered by the journalist writing the email.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His story and links to Peter Mandelson are the subject of the journalist's planned article.

connections.description: The journalist asserts Mandelson has 'links to Epstein' which should disqualify him from a diplomatic appointment.
Bates provided photos that featured Mandelson, which were printed by the Daily Mail in a story about Epstein.

events.title: Journalist contacts source about Mandelson article
events.description: A British journalist emails Daniel Bates to discuss contributing to a piece for The Sun about Peter Mandelson's Epstein links and his potential appointment as UK ambassador to the US.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell trial
events.description: Referenced as an event covered by the journalist who is writing the email.

events.title: Daily Mail publishes photos of Mandelson
events.description: The Daily Mail previously printed photos of Peter Mandelson, sourced from Daniel Bates, in a story related to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Peter Mandelson, a British ex-cabinet minister, is reportedly set to be appointed as the UK ambassador to the United States.
A journalist is preparing an article arguing that Mandelson's links to Jeffrey Epstein should disqualify him from the ambassadorial post.
The journalist and recipient Daniel Bates previously collaborated indirectly when the Daily Mail printed Bates's photos in an Epstein-related story featuring Mandelson.
The correspondence indicates ongoing media scrutiny of political figures associated with Jeffrey Epstein years after his death.
